A toggle for 'Show advanced settings' is enabled, revealing a 'Meeting room template' dropdown with options: Empty meeting room (selected), New projects template, and Sales template. The bottom right features 'Cancel' and 'Save the meeting type' buttons. The left sidebar shows navigation for Dashboard, Scheduling (Meetings, Meeting types, Calendar settings), Meeting rooms, Contact widgets, Contact forms, and Settings.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: A table view in Teamleader Focus showing a 'Refused' category with financial totals and a clickable link.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This image shows a section of a list or report table. It features a collapsible row labeled 'Refused' with a downward-pointing arrow. To the right, there are two financial columns showing totals of € 133.401,06 and € 132.610,06. Below this header row, a specific entry named 'Test Jean-Charles' is shown as a blue hyperlink, with a mouse cursor hovering over it. This entry has its own corresponding values of € 99.761,56 and € 99.661,56. This interface is typical for viewing grouped deals, quotations, or invoices by status.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Add Integration' widget for connecting Teamleader Focus to another application via WebHook.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A dark-themed UI card for adding integrations. It features a large green circle with a white plus icon at the top. Below the icon, the text 'to Another Application' is displayed next to a help question mark icon. There is a dropdown menu currently set to 'WebHook' and a button labeled 'Add Integration' at the bottom. This interface is used for setting up external connections and API webhooks within the Teamleader Focus settings.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Weekly timesheet overview showing tracked hours and progress bars for each day.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A list view of a work week (Monday, Aug 23 to Friday, Aug 27) in Teamleader Focus. Each row represents a day and includes an expandable arrow, the date, a progress bar indicating tracked time versus total capacity, and a 'plus' icon button for adding time tracking. Monday shows 3h00 / 8h00, Tuesday shows 6h00 / 8h00, and Thursday (marked with a 'Today' badge) shows 3h03 / 8h00. Wednesday and Friday display specific time ranges (9:00 AM to 5:00 PM) instead of hour totals.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: A list of deals in Teamleader Focus grouped by Deal phase with an expanded 'Contacted' section.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A table view showing deals grouped by their pipeline stage. The columns are 'Deal phase' and 'Title'. The 'Deal phase' column is sorted in ascending order. Several phases are visible: 'Accepted' (collapsed), 'Contacted' (expanded), 'Meeting planned' (collapsed), 'New' (collapsed), and 'Quotation sent' (expanded but empty in view). Under the expanded 'Contacted' phase, four deals are listed by title: 'Análisis de datos', 'Tables', 'Offerte', and 'New Deal'. A mouse cursor is hovering over the collapse/expand arrow for the 'Contacted' phase.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Kanban board view for a project titled 'Rebranding marketing campaign' in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: The screenshot displays the Kanban board interface within a project. The project name is 'Rebranding marketing campaign'. Navigation tabs include Work breakdown, Kanban, Project info, and Invoices. The Kanban board is organized into four columns: TO DO (9), IN PROGRESS (2), ON HOLD (0), and DONE (0). Individual task cards show task titles (e.g., Task 1, Task 2), categories (Photography, Graphic design, Webontwikkeling), assigned team members via initials/avatars, and some include time tracking (1h00/-) or due dates (28/09/2023). A filter bar at the top allows users to filter by 'Type' and specific team members.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Browser permission settings for camera and microphone access in Teamleader Focus meeting rooms.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the Google Chrome site settings dropdown for cloud.teamleader.eu. It shows the permissions for a meeting room URL. The 'Camera' and 'Microphone' toggles are both switched off (disabled), indicated by grey sliders and red 'x' icons next to the camera and microphone symbols. There is a 'Reset permissions' button. Below the permissions, it shows 'Cookies' (88 in use) and a link to 'Site settings'. This image is useful for troubleshooting audio or video issues in Teamleader Focus meetings by showing where to enable hardware access.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Linked expenses' section within the Project info tab of a Teamleader Focus project.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the 'Project info' tab in a project. It highlights the 'Linked expenses' widget, which is currently empty, showing the text 'This project has no linked expenses yet.' There is a clickable blue link and a plus icon labeled '+ Link expenses to project' to add new costs to the project. The navigation menu at the top shows other project tabs: Work breakdown, Kanban, and Invoices.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Bulk actions menu in a Teamleader Focus list view, highlighting the 'Sync with Dropbox' option.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of a list view in Teamleader Focus, likely within the Contacts or Companies module. A segment filter titled 'Open invoices (±22)' is selected in the top left. On the right, the 'Actions' dropdown menu is open, displaying several bulk processing options: Merge, Create calls, Create tasks, Download label, Change account manager, Add tag, Remove tag, Create invoices, Delete, and 'Sync with Dropbox' (highlighted). The background table shows columns for Unbilled time, Phone, Country, Language, City, and Prepaid balance.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Time tracking entry in Teamleader Focus with the actions menu open to copy or edit the entry.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the time tracking interface showing a logged entry for 'Mon, Oct 18'. The entry is for 'NV Teamleader' under the 'Design' category and is marked as 'Non-billable'. It shows a duration of '01h59 (11:51 - 13:50)'. A timeline visualization at the top right highlights this specific time block. The three-dot vertical ellipsis menu is highlighted with a red box, showing a dropdown menu with 'Copy' and 'Edit' options. To the left of the menu is a pencil icon for quick editing.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Invoice items' section in Teamleader Focus showing unit selection for line items.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A close-up of the 'INVOICE ITEMS' form section. It displays two line items with columns for Description, Price, and Quantity. For the first item, a dropdown menu for units is open, showing options: None, /Meter, /Unit, /STUK, /SET, /km, and /Richtprijs. There is also an '+ Add discount' button visible below the first line item's price field. This interface is used when creating or editing invoices, quotations, or subscriptions to specify the measurement unit for products or services.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Teamleader Focus session expired and CSRF token error messages
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A composite image showing two types of login/session errors in Teamleader Focus. The left side shows a login field with the error message 'Error: CSRF Failed: CSRF token missing or incorrect.' below a 'Continue' button. The right side shows a 'Your session has expired' notification banner with instructions to 'Make sure cookies are enabled' and a teal button labeled 'reload the page'. These errors typically occur due to browser cookie settings or long periods of inactivity.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: A dialog box in Teamleader Focus for managing time off requests from a specific user.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This dialog window is titled 'Request for time off by Kirchmann'. It displays a list of pending time off requests with columns for the reason (Sickness, Overhours, Jour de fête), the date, and the duration (Full day off). For each entry, there are two action buttons: a green 'ACCEPT' button with a checkmark and a red 'REFUSE' button with an 'X'. At the bottom right, there is a teal 'SAVE' button to confirm the decisions. This interface is used by managers to approve or deny employee leave and absence requests.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Form for adding unavailable dates in Teamleader Focus
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A UI component showing the '1 Unavailable date' section expanded. It contains two date input fields: 'Start date' with the value '2023-04-05' and 'End date (inclusive)' with the value '2023-04-07'. To the right of the date fields is a trash can icon for deletion. Below the fields is a button labeled '+ Add dates' to include additional time ranges. This is typically used for managing user availability or planning.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Add Project' dialog in Teamleader Focus with the 'Template' field highlighted.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the 'Add Project' creation form. The 'Template' dropdown field is highlighted with a red border and is currently set to 'Don't use'. Other visible fields include 'Project title' (filled with 'Project 100'), 'Customer' (set to 'Eline Grootaert'), 'Start date' (15/07/2021), 'End date' (empty), and 'Budget planning' (set to € 102,00). This interface is used when a user wants to create a new project, specifically showing where to select a project template.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Project planning overview in Teamleader Focus showing the work breakdown structure.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A detailed view of 'Project 20' in Teamleader Focus. The header displays project metadata: Owner (Eline), Assignees (Unassigned), Customer (NV Teamleader), Billing method (Time and materials), and financial info (Price: € 3.230,00). The 'Work breakdown' tab is active, showing a list of task groups. Two groups are visible: 'Administration' with four tasks (Article 1-4) and 'Execution' with two tasks (Article 1-2). Each task has a status of 'To do'. Action buttons include 'Add group' and 'Add task'. Columns in the table include Title, Assignees, Status, and End date.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Detail view of Quotation 279 in Teamleader Focus highlighting the profit margin field.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A header for 'Quotation 279' with a 'Sent' status badge. The details section shows metadata including Customer (EN CLIENT), Deal (EN DEAL), Date created (30/05/2022), and Company Entity (Red Cross). On the right side, financial information is displayed: Total excl. VAT (€ 1.000,00) and Profit margin (+ € 1.000,00), which is highlighted with a teal box. There is also a link for CloudSign activity marked as 'Online' and a 'Hide details' button in the top right corner.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Add segment' dialog box in Teamleader Focus for creating filtered lists of contacts or items.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: The 'Add segment' form is divided into two sections. Under 'GENERAL INFORMATION', there is a 'Name' text field with the value 'Import', an 'Advanced options' link, and a toggle switch for 'Only I can see this segment' set to 'YES'. The 'SEGMENT RULES' section includes a dropdown for 'Rule' set to 'All rules must apply' and a '+' button to add more rules. 'Rule 1' is configured with three fields: a category dropdown set to 'Date added', an operator dropdown set to 'Equals', and a value field containing '19/05/2017'. A trash icon is available to delete the rule. A teal 'SAVE' button with a checkmark is located at the bottom right.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Settings page for syncing booked meetings with Teamleader Focus calendar events.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This settings interface allows users to integrate meeting bookings with their Teamleader Focus account. It features a 'Settings' section with a checkbox labeled 'Create a calendar event through Teamleader Focus', which is currently checked. Below the checkbox is an explanatory note regarding calendar synchronization with external providers like Google or Microsoft via the marketplace. A teal 'Update' button is located at the bottom left to save changes. The top of the page includes a brief overview text with links to 'meeting types' and a 'full help article'.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Edit Contact functions' dialog box for managing job title options in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Edit Contact functions' used to manage the list of available job titles or roles. It features an 'Options' section with a '+' button to add new entries and an 'ABC' button for alphabetical sorting. The current list includes three text fields with the values 'CEO', 'Administration', and 'Consultant'. Each entry has icons for reordering (up/down arrows) and a trash can icon for deletion. A footer note explains that these options are for hinting and won't alter existing database content. There is a teal 'SAVE' button with a checkmark in the bottom right corner.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Invoices tab in a project showing financial summaries, invoices, and credit notes for a customer.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: The Invoices tab within a project view provides a financial overview. At the top, summary cards display 'Total price (excl. VAT)' of € 2.800,00, 'Amount billed (excl. VAT)' of € 0,00, and 'Amount paid (incl. VAT)' of € 3.388,00. An 'Add Invoice' button is available in the top right. The main table lists documents for 'NV Teamleader' across two collapsible sections: 'Invoices' and 'Credit notes'. Invoice 2025/1 is shown with a 'Credited' status, while Credit note 2025/1 is shown with a 'Booked' status. Table columns include No., Customer, Date, Amount billed (excl. VAT), Amount paid (incl. VAT), and Status.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: User profile management view in Teamleader Focus showing user details and admin actions.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A detailed view of a user profile (Sara) within the settings. The header displays the user's name, an 'Active' status badge, and an email address (blurred). Action buttons include 'Deactivate user' and 'Make admin'. The profile information section includes fields for Function, Phone, Mobile, Internal cost (€ 0,00/h), External price (€ 50,00/h), and Team (Administratie). At the bottom, there are tabs for 'Permissions' (currently active) and 'Work info'. This screen is used for managing team members and their billable rates.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The active recording interface in Teamleader Focus showing controls and temporary local recordings.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A 'Recordings' dialog box showing an active recording in progress with a duration of 00:00:55. It features 'Pause' and 'Stop' buttons. Below the active recording is a 'Temporary local recordings' section with a warning message: 'Your browser may delete these at any time. We recommend uploading them to your account or storing them in a safe place at the earliest convenient time.' An existing recording from 20 September 2022 is listed with its duration (23s) and file size (206 KB), accompanied by action icons for upload to cloud, download, play, and delete.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The top navigation bar in Teamleader Focus featuring search, quick add, and sync options.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A close-up of the Teamleader Focus header navigation. From left to right, it includes: a global 'Search' bar; a teal '+' button for quick creation of items; a 'Sync' icon (circular arrows) highlighted with a red circle; a 'Community' or 'Users' icon; a 'Help' question mark icon; a 'Gift/What's new' icon; and the user's profile avatar. This interface is used for navigating the platform and accessing global actions.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Overview of document layout variations for quotations, invoices, and reports in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This screenshot shows the document layout management interface in Teamleader Focus. It displays two sets of layout variations: 'Desk2020' and 'Second layout variation'. Each section contains thumbnail previews for different document types including Quotations, Invoices, Time tracking reports, Orders, Order Confirmations, Delivery notes, and Work Orders. A blue 'Default' badge is visible on the Quotations layout for Desk2020 and on the Invoices layout for the Second layout variation. In the top right of the second section, there are icons for editing (pencil) and archiving (box). This interface is used to manage the visual branding and templates for customer-facing documents.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: An API POST request to list custom field definitions in Teamleader Focus using JSON.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This screenshot shows an API client interface making a POST request to the endpoint 'https://api.teamleader.eu/customFieldDefinitions.list'. The request body is in JSON format and includes pagination and sorting parameters. Specifically, it defines a 'page' object with 'size: 100' and 'number: 1', and a 'sort' array targeting the 'label' field in ascending ('asc') order. The interface includes tabs for OAuth 2, Query, Header, and Docs, with a 'Send' button in the top right corner.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Activities section in Teamleader Focus showing a filtered view of virtual meetings.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the 'Activities' timeline within a CRM record. It features an 'Email tracking' button at the top right and an '+ Add note' link. A dropdown filter is highlighted with a red box, currently set to 'Virtual meeting (1)', with a 'Disable filter' option next to it. Below the filter, a specific activity is displayed: a note tagged as 'Virtual meeting' from 'Eline' stating 'Meeting went fine, will sign quotation tomorrow', posted '1 hour ago'. This view demonstrates how users can filter the activity log to find specific interaction types.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Excel spreadsheet showing a VLOOKUP formula used to link contact data with company addresses.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of an Excel spreadsheet being used to prepare data for import into Teamleader Focus. The image shows a column 'Company Street+Number' (Column E) where a Dutch VLOOKUP formula (=VERT.ZOEKEN) is being used to pull address information from a 'Companies' sheet based on a lookup value in cell B4. The formula shown is '=VERT.ZOEKEN($B4;Companies!A3:F2245;3;ONWAAR)'. Several cells are highlighted with blue boxes to demonstrate different results: an error (#N/B), a successful address match ('Avenue Gen Leclerc 76'), and a zero value ('0'). This illustrates the data cleaning and preparation phase before importing contacts and companies into the CRM.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Documents section header with the plus icon to add a new document.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A close-up of the 'DOCUMENTS' section header in Teamleader Focus. To the right of the text, there is a plus (+) icon highlighted with a red selection box, which is used to upload or create a new document. Next to the plus icon is a folder icon representing the document storage or file manager.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Google integration settings in Teamleader Focus for syncing tasks, resources, Drive, and contacts.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A settings menu for Google integration with several toggle switches and a 'SAVE' button. Under 'Extra options', the toggles for 'Also push Planned tasks' and 'Google Resources' are enabled (teal), while 'Also push Calls' is disabled (grey). A tooltip for Google Resources explains: 'Use this to manage your meeting rooms. Note that this only works for Google Apps for Work accounts'. Below this, the 'Google Drive' toggle is enabled and 'Google Contacts' is disabled. This screen allows users to configure the data sync between Teamleader Focus and Google Workspace.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Converting a deal to a project or invoice in Teamleader Focus
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A close-up of a deal detail page showing conversion options. The top section displays deal information: Deal name (EN DEAL), Total excl. VAT (€ 1.000,00), Profit margin (+ € 1.000,00), and CloudSign activity (Online). Below this, action buttons are visible: a 'Convert to invoice' button with a dropdown arrow that reveals the 'Convert to project' option, and a teal 'Send quotation' button. The 'Convert to project' option is highlighted with a teal box to demonstrate how to start a project from a won deal.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Export log table in Teamleader Focus showing a history of data exports and download links.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A table titled 'Export log' displaying a history of data exports. The table includes columns for: 'Subject' (e.g., Companies, Deals, Tickets, Subscriptions, Products, Calls, Meetings, Tasks), 'Segment' (e.g., Activity, Open invoices), 'User' (all entries show 'Eline'), 'Date' (timestamp of export), 'Done' (status badge showing 'Yes'), and 'Download' (a button to download the specific export file). This view allows users to track and retrieve previous exports of CRM data.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Connect your domain' dialog showing DNS records to install for email white-labeling.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Connect your domain' with the subtitle 'Install your DNS records'. It displays a table with three CNAME records required for domain verification. Each row includes the Record type (CNAME), Name (e.g., em8451.teamleader.eu), and Value (e.g., u621505.wl006.sendgrid.net). There are copy icons next to each individual name and value. At the bottom left, there is a prominent 'Copy all' button highlighted in yellow. At the bottom right, there is a teal 'Done' button. The interface is used for setting up custom domain sending and DKIM/SPF records via SendGrid.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Upcoming meetings table in Teamleader Focus with options to change meeting room or cancel.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A table titled 'Upcoming meetings' showing a scheduled meeting. Columns include: 'Meeting with' (showing avatars and 'john doe' for Tomorrow, 12:30–13:00), 'Meeting Type' (Online meeting), 'Type' (Online badge), 'Duration' (30 minutes), and 'Location' (link to john-doe). A three-dot menu on the right is open, displaying two options: 'Change meeting room' and 'Cancel meeting' in red text. Below the table, a 'Past meetings' section header is visible.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Expenses module toggle switch in Teamleader Focus settings.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A settings card titled 'EXPENSES' with a wallet icon. It contains a single row labeled 'Expenses' with a teal-colored toggle switch set to the 'on' position. This interface is used to enable or disable the expenses feature within the platform.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Send invoices' dialog in Teamleader Focus for bulk sending invoices via email or Peppol.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This dialog allows users to send multiple invoices at once. On the left, invoices are grouped by customer language (French, German, English) with checkboxes to select specific invoices like '2025 / 2' or '2024 / 4'. Icons next to invoice numbers indicate if they will be sent via email or Peppol. Two warning banners at the top inform the user about Peppol network usage and multiple customer languages. The right side contains a form with fields for 'Template' selection, 'Email subject', and 'Email message content'. A 'Link timesheets' dropdown is open, showing options for 'PDF timesheets' and 'Excel timesheets'. At the bottom, there is a 'Show variables' toggle and buttons for 'Cancel' and 'Send 7 invoices' (currently disabled).

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: A list view showing recordings in meeting rooms of your team in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: The image displays a section titled 'RECORDINGS IN MEETING ROOMS OF YOUR TEAM' with a help icon. It shows a single row representing a recorded meeting with the following details: a play icon, the date and time '22 September 2022 12:06', a clickable link to the meeting room named 'test-meeting-room-1', the team member's name with their initials 'TM' in a circle, the duration of the recording '32m 20s', and the file size '665 KB'.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Table showing CNAME DNS records for domain verification with copy buttons.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A table displaying DNS configuration records required for email domain verification in Teamleader Focus. The table has three columns: 'Record' (all listed as CNAME), 'Name', and 'Value'. Each 'Name' and 'Value' field has an adjacent copy icon (highlighted in yellow boxes) for easy transfer to a DNS provider. Below the table, there is a 'Copy all' button and a teal 'Done' button. The records shown include 'em6375.teamleader.eu' pointing to 'u621505.wl006.sendgrid.net' and two domainkey records pointing to SendGrid addresses, indicating an integration for email deliverability.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Save filter' dialog box in Teamleader Focus for naming and saving project filter criteria.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Save filter' used to create a reusable filter. It contains a 'Title' text input field with the value 'Project filters 1'. Below this, an 'APPLIED FILTERS' section displays the active criteria being saved: 'Budget status: Over budget' and 'Customer: Apple'. The dialog includes a blue 'Cancel' text link and a teal 'Save' button in the top right corner.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Edit Fiscal year' dialog box in Teamleader Focus for configuring accounting periods.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Edit Fiscal year' used to manage accounting periods. It contains fields for 'Fiscal year' (set to 2025), 'Start date' (01-01-2025), and 'End date' (31-12-2025). There is a 'Start number' field with a tooltip explaining 'Your first invoice of this fiscal year will start at this number.' An additional checkbox for 'Alternative fiscal year for credit notes' is visible. The bottom of the form includes a red 'Delete' button on the left and a teal 'SAVE' button with a checkmark on the right. This interface is part of the invoicing and financial settings.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'plus' button dropdown menu in Teamleader Focus for creating new items.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A close-up of the global 'Add' (+) button in the top navigation bar. The dropdown menu is open, showing options to create a new Task, Meeting, Call, Company, Contact, Deal, or Quotation. In the background, an 'Add quotation' button is visible alongside a 'CloudSign activity' log showing several 'Offline' status entries with 'View activity' links. The top bar also features a search field, user icon, help icon, time tracker (00:00), and a video camera icon.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Octopus accounting integration settings page in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This screenshot shows the configuration page for the Octopus accounting integration within Teamleader Focus. The interface includes a sidebar with navigation links like 'Users', 'Teams', and 'Integrations'. The main content area displays the Octopus logo and name, with a teal 'Sync' button and a vertical ellipsis menu in the top right. Below the header, there are tabs for 'Details', 'Discounts', 'VAT codes', 'Ledgers', and 'Synchronisation'. The 'Details' tab is currently active, showing an 'Integration details' card with an edit pencil icon. The card displays a 'Start date' of 11/12/2025 and the 'Entity' name 'Test Company'. A back link labeled 'Company information overview' is visible at the top left of the main panel.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Saving a quotation as a template from the deal follow-up page in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: The screenshot shows the 'Follow up on your open deal' section with the 'Quotations' tab active. A specific quotation, 'Quotation 279', is listed with an amount of € 1.000,00 and a status of 'Sent'. An actions dropdown menu is open for this quotation, with the option 'Save quotation as template' highlighted in a teal box at the bottom. Other menu options include Edit, Mark as sent, Mark as accepted, Mark as refused, Rename, Copy, and Go to detail page. Below the quotation list, there are widgets for 'Scheduled actions' (with buttons for Meeting, Call, and Task) and 'Files' showing the PDF version of the quotation.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Share with a colleague' dialog box in Teamleader Focus for internal collaboration.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This image shows the user interface for sharing a record or item with a colleague. At the top, there is a header with a 'Share with a colleague' button next to a primary action button. Below this, a modal dialog titled 'Share with a colleague' is open. The dialog includes a searchable dropdown field to select a user, currently displaying a list of colleagues with their profile pictures and names (represented by placeholders). One colleague is highlighted in light blue. At the bottom of the modal, there is a list of users who already have access, indicated by initials in a circle (e.g., 'SA') and placeholder text for their names and permissions.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Security settings page showing the toggle to enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the 'Security' section in Teamleader Focus settings. It features a card titled 'Enforce Multi-Factor Authentication' with a toggle switch currently set to the 'off' position. Next to the toggle is the text 'Make Multi-Factor Authentication mandatory for all users.' Below this, a subtext note explains that this 'Applies for all active and new users added in the future' and includes a 'Read more' link for MFA security information.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The three dots menu in Teamleader Focus with options to set as default, deactivate, or delete.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A close-up of a contextual actions menu triggered by a vertical three-dots (ellipsis) icon. The menu contains three options: 'Set as default' (highlighted with a teal box), 'Deactivate', and 'Delete' (written in red text). Above the menu, a progress bar with one teal segment and three grey segments is visible. This menu is typically used for managing settings like document templates, payment terms, or custom fields.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Microsoft account sign-in dialog for integrating external services with Teamleader Focus
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A standard Microsoft 'Sign in' dialog box. It features the Microsoft logo and a text input field with the placeholder 'Email address, phone number or Skype'. Below the input, there are links for 'No account? Create one!' and 'Can't access your account?'. At the bottom right, there are two buttons: a grey 'Back' button and a blue 'Next' button. A separate white box below the main dialog contains a key icon and the text 'Sign-in options'. This screen appears when a user attempts to connect their Microsoft account (e.g., for Outlook or Calendar integration) to Teamleader Focus.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Edit schedule' dialog in Teamleader Focus for configuring a user's weekly working hours.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Edit schedule for katrin7' used to set availability. It lists days from Monday to Sunday. Monday through Thursday are toggled to 'YES' (green) with working hours set from 09:00 to 17:00. Friday, Saturday, and Sunday are toggled off (grey). Each active day has a 'Lunch break' toggle which is currently disabled for all days. A teal 'SAVE' button with a checkmark icon is located at the bottom right. This interface is used for HR settings, planning, and resource management.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The task side panel in Teamleader Focus showing the 'Plan in planning' link within the Planning section.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the task detail side panel in Teamleader Focus. The panel includes sections for 'Details' and 'Planning'. Under 'Details', fields for Assignees (currently Unassigned) and Work type are visible. The 'Planning' section shows a Start date (01-06-2024), End date (30-06-2024), Time estimated, and Time planned (00h00). A teal arrow points to the 'Plan in planning' link, which is highlighted with a teal box. Below this, there is a 'Time tracked' field and an '+ Add time tracking' button. The background shows project-level details like 'Billing method: Time and materials'.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The account information and documentation setup checklist in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A split-view interface showing a navigation sidebar and a setup checklist. The sidebar on the left includes 'Get started' (highlighted in blue), 'Transactions', and 'Orders'. The main panel on the right displays 'Account information' with steps: 'Organisational details' (completed/grey), 'Stakeholders' (active/blue), 'Business activity', and 'Payment methods'. Below this is a 'Documentation' section where 'ID document' is highlighted with a red box and arrow, followed by 'Bank accounts'. This screen is used for onboarding and verifying account details for payment integrations.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Generate report' dialog box in Teamleader Focus for project or time tracking reporting.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Generate report'. It includes an information banner stating that the date range applies to time tracking, expenses, and invoicing. The form contains a 'Groups' dropdown (set to 'All'), and date picker fields for 'Start date' and 'End date' (DD-MM-YYYY). Under 'REPORT CONTENTS', there are five checkboxes, all currently selected: 'Budgeting information of selected groups', 'Time tracking details', 'Materials', 'Linked expenses' (highlighted with a blue box), and 'Invoice information'. The dialog has two buttons at the bottom right: 'Cancel' and a teal 'Generate' button.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Billing settings dialog in Teamleader Focus for configuring prepaid billing and auto-invoicing.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Billing settings' showing configuration options for prepaid credits. It includes a toggle for 'Allow prepaid billing' (enabled) with a 'Prepaid credits' field set to € 1000,00. A second toggle for 'Automatic invoicing' is also enabled, revealing additional fields: a 'Department' dropdown (currently unselected), an 'Auto invoice if credits fall below' field set to € 100,00, and an 'Amount to invoice excl. VAT' field set to € 0,00. The dialog features 'Cancel' and 'Save' buttons at the bottom right.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Work Orders overview table in Teamleader Focus showing status and customer details.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A list view of Work Orders in Teamleader Focus. The table includes columns for Title, Customer (e.g., 'twoway'), Employees (shown with initials like 'TH'), Date added, Intervention date, Status, and Project. Status labels shown include 'Final' (green), 'Sent' (blue), and 'Draft' (purple). There is a search bar at the top left to filter the work orders. Most entries show 'No title' and 'No project' in this specific view.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Colleagues attending' and 'Contacts attending' sections in a Teamleader Focus meeting view.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A close-up of a meeting or calendar event interface. The top section, 'Colleagues attending', shows a list of internal team members (e.g., Eline) with an edit pencil icon in the header. The bottom section, 'Contacts attending', features a plus (+) icon highlighted in a red box, which is the button used to add external CRM contacts to the meeting.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Insights module access toggle in Teamleader Focus settings.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A settings interface section titled 'INSIGHTS' with a bar chart icon. It contains a single toggle switch labeled 'Insights' with the subtext 'Access to the Insights module.' The toggle is currently in the 'on' position (teal color).

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Teamleader Focus planning board showing tasks assigned to a user and the 'Convert to timesheet' link.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A view of the planning or resource management tool in Teamleader Focus. On the left, a user profile for 'Charlotte Pauwels' shows a capacity of 10h00/40h00 with a 'Convert to timesheet' action link. To the right, a calendar-style grid displays tasks scheduled across different days. Tasks include 'Website design' (2h), 'Interface design' (2h), 'Message mining exercise' (3h), and a 'Sync' meeting (3h). Each day has a progress bar showing total hours planned versus capacity (e.g., 2h/8h, 5h/8h, 3h/8h). Tasks are color-coded (blue for tasks, teal for meetings) and include the name of the related contact 'Simon Floré'.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Actions' dropdown menu for targets in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A close-up of the 'Actions' button and its expanded dropdown menu. The menu contains four options with corresponding icons: 'Refresh current period' (circular arrows), 'Edit target' (pencil), 'Copy target' (overlapping squares), and 'Delete' (X icon). This menu is typically used when managing sales targets or performance goals within the platform.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: A list of folders and files in Teamleader Focus with a context menu showing file actions.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A table view showing a list of folders and their creation dates. The columns are 'Folder' and 'Date added'. Several rows are visible, including 'Folder 1', 'Folder 2', and 'Folder 3'. A plus icon (+) is located at the top right for adding new items. A context menu (three vertical dots) is open for one of the entries, displaying the following options: 'Download file', 'Send by email', 'Show history' (highlighted with a teal box), and 'Delete file' (in red text). This interface is used for document management and tracking file versions.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Configuration field for 'The meeting host is not present' notification message.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A form section in Teamleader Focus settings for customizing the message shown when a meeting host is absent. It features a text input area containing placeholder text and separators (***, ---, ___). Below the input box, there is a 'Preview:' section showing how the formatted text will appear to users. This is used for setting up automated meeting or scheduling notifications.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The ticketing statistics navigation menu and the 'Created vs closed' report view in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot showing the sidebar menu for ticketing statistics and the header of the 'Created vs closed' report. The sidebar includes options for: Created vs closed (selected), First response time, Average response time, Full resolution time, Busiest time of the day, Ticket distribution, Individual performance, Top 25 customers, and Duration open tickets. The main content area shows the title 'Created vs closed' with a help icon and a date range picker set to '01 Sep 2018 - 30 Sep 2018' above a chart area.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Quotation preferences menu showing the option to allow customers to refuse quotations on CloudSign.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the 'Preferences' section in Teamleader Focus settings, specifically for quotations. It features five toggle switches. The fourth option, 'Allow customers to refuse quotations on CloudSign', is highlighted with a teal border and is toggled 'on'. Other visible settings include: 'Send quotations in attachment when sending to customers' (on), 'Receive email copy when sending quotations' (off), 'Notify me whenever a quotation is accepted' (on), and 'Show defaults terms and conditions on quotations' (on).

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Configuration interface for adding a dropdown selection question to a Teamleader Focus form.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This interface shows the setup for a form question titled 'Which product do you prefer?'. On the left, the 'Type' is set to 'Dropdown selection' with three options: 'Product A', 'Product B', and 'Product C', each with a delete icon. There is an 'Add an option...' field and an unchecked 'An answer is required' checkbox. A 'Link answer to Teamleader Focus' dropdown allows mapping the response to CRM fields. The right side shows a 'PREVIEW' of the dropdown menu. Action buttons at the bottom right are 'Cancel' and 'Save question'.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: An Excel spreadsheet example for importing company and contact data into Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of a Microsoft Excel file formatted for data import. The spreadsheet contains two tabs at the bottom: 'Contacts' and 'Companies' (currently active). The columns are labeled: Name (A), Language (B), Street + Nr (C), City (D), Country (E), and Sector (F). The rows contain sample data for various companies with values such as 'EN', 'DE', 'NL' for language and country codes like 'BE', 'AT', 'DE', 'NL', 'AU', 'ES', 'CH'. This illustrates the required structure for a CSV or Excel import of CRM data.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Notification banner in Teamleader Focus reminding a user to send a quotation reminder.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A top-level notification banner within a quotation detail page. The banner features a bell icon and the text: 'This quotation for € 1.000,00 will expire in 7 days. Send Bill Gates a reminder.' The name 'Bill Gates' is a clickable link to trigger the reminder workflow. Above the banner, the standard Teamleader Focus header is visible, including a 'Quotations overview' back button, a search bar, a '+' quick-add button, a timer showing '00:00', and user profile icons. An 'X' button on the right allows the user to dismiss the notification.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Manage columns' dialog in Teamleader Focus for customizing list views.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Manage columns' used to customize table views. It features two columns: 'Available columns' on the left and 'Selected columns' on the right. Users can drag and drop items between columns or reorder them. The image shows a hand cursor dragging 'Account manager' into the 'Selected columns' list. Available columns include Active, APE Code, BIC - SWIFT, Date added, and more. Selected columns include Name, Website, Number of unbilled minutes, Phone, Country, Language, City, Prepaid credits left, and VAT number. Action buttons at the bottom right are 'Cancel' and 'Save'.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: QR code with a lightning bolt logo in the center for mobile app pairing or authentication.
Browser permission settings for Teamleader Focus meeting rooms in Safari.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot showing the Safari browser's website settings popover for cloud.teamleader.eu. The settings include checkboxes for 'Use Reader when available' and 'Enable content blockers' (both unchecked). It displays Page Zoom at 100%, Auto-Play set to 'Stop Media with Sound', and Pop-up Windows set to 'Block and Notify'. Crucially for meeting functionality, it shows permissions for Camera, Microphone, Screen Sharing, and Location all set to 'Ask'. In the background, the Teamleader Focus meeting interface is visible with options for Whiteboard, Upload file, Share screen, and Cobrowse.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Send quotation' dialog box in Teamleader Focus for emailing a quote to a customer.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A pop-up window titled 'Send quotation' containing several email fields. The 'Sender' dropdown is set to 'eline@teamleader.be (Eline)'. The 'To' field contains 'billgates@gmail.com' with a '+ CC' button next to it. There are empty text fields for 'BCC' and 'Subject'. A 'Template' dropdown shows 'No template selected', and a 'Signature' field is pre-filled with 'Red Cross'. At the bottom right, there are two buttons: a white 'Cancel' button and a teal 'Send' button.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Notification banner requiring users to set up Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A horizontal notification banner with a light yellow background and a bell icon. The text states: 'Your account admin has required all users to use Multi-Factor Authentication for security reasons. You will be logged out at midnight and will be required to set up MFA to log in again.' It includes a clickable hyperlink labeled 'Set up MFA now.' This is a mandatory security warning for Teamleader Focus users when MFA is enforced at the account level.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The calculation breakdown for a deal's amount in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the 'Details' widget for a deal, showing an open popover for the 'View calculation' link next to the Amount field. The popover, titled 'Calculation', shows that the deal value of € 425,00 is calculated based on 4 quotations with a total amount of € 1.700,00. It includes an explanation text: 'The deal value is an approximation of the amount of money it could potentially bring in by looking at the average amount across all quotations in this deal.' Other visible fields in the background include Probability, Assignee, Margin, and Company under the Customer section.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Contact forms overview in Teamleader Focus Lead capture Booster showing a list of created forms.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: The screenshot displays the 'Contact forms' section within the Lead capture Booster. A sidebar on the left shows navigation options like Dashboard, Scheduling, Meeting rooms, Contact widgets, and Settings. The main area features a 'Contact forms' header with a 'Create a form' button. There are tabs for 'Personal' (selected) and 'Team'. A table lists existing forms with columns for Title (Form 2, Form 1), Responses (0 responses), Created by (rome paris), and Data sent to (Contact and deal). Each row includes action icons for editing (pencil), sharing (network icon), and a three-dot menu for more options.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Navigation path in WinBooks to access Journal codes (Dagboekcodes) via Bestand > Tabellen.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of the WinBooks accounting software interface, often used in conjunction with Teamleader Focus for bookkeeping. The image shows the nested menu navigation: 'Bestand' (File) > 'Tabellen' (Tables) > 'Dagboekcodes' (Journal codes). 'Dagboekcodes' is currently highlighted in blue. Other visible options in the 'Tabellen' submenu include Landcodes, Postcodes, Categorieën, Taalcodes, and Betalingstermijn. This screen is relevant for users setting up the accounting export and needing to verify journal codes for synchronization.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Advanced options for API authentication showing refresh, identity, and access tokens.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A dark-themed UI panel under 'Advanced Options' for managing API authentication tokens. It features a 'Response Timeline' button with a bug icon. There are three read-only text fields: 'REFRESH TOKEN' containing a long alphanumeric string, 'IDENTITY TOKEN' showing 'n/a', and 'ACCESS TOKEN (EXPIRES JUST NOW)' containing a long encoded string. At the bottom right, there are two action buttons: 'Clear' and 'Refresh Token'. This screen is typically used for debugging integrations or manually refreshing API access.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: A preview of a Teamleader Focus landing page for downloading a whitepaper.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A preview screen showing a landing page or confirmation page created with Teamleader Focus. It features the Teamleader logo at the top, followed by the heading 'Thank you for your interest!'. Below is a graphic titled 'DIGITAL MARKETING TRENDS OF 2024'. The text explains that the user can download the whitepaper by clicking the button. A teal call-to-action button is labeled 'Digital marketing in 2024'. At the bottom, there is a 'Powered by Teamleader' badge. This image demonstrates the output of a lead capture or marketing automation workflow.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Notification banner confirming that a project export is ready for download.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A dark blue notification banner in Teamleader Focus with white text stating 'Your export of 109 projects is ready!'. To the right of the message, there is a clickable blue underlined link labeled 'Download' to retrieve the exported file.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Related contacts' list in Teamleader Focus showing contact details and action menu.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A view of the 'Related contacts' section within a company or project page. It lists contacts with their initials (LV, DN), full names (Leonardo Da Vinci, Donatello Di Niccolo), job titles (CEO), and email addresses. A three-dot vertical menu is open for one contact, showing options to 'Edit', 'Unlink', and 'Add call'. A star icon next to the names indicates a primary or favorite contact status.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Mark call as done' dialog box in Teamleader Focus for logging call outcomes and summaries.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A modal window titled 'Mark call as done' used to log phone conversation details. It contains a 'CONVERSATION' section with two fields: a required 'Call outcome' dropdown (currently set to 'Voicemail') and a 'Summary' text area for notes. At the bottom right, there is a teal button labeled 'SAVE AND MARK CALL AS DONE' with a checkmark icon. The header includes a telephone icon and a close (X) button.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Configuration screen for creating a custom contact widget button for a website.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: The 'Contact widget' setup screen is divided into four numbered sections. Section 1, 'DESIGN YOUR BUTTON', includes fields for 'Button color' (#00b2b2), 'Button text color' (#ffffff), 'Button text' ('Book a meeting'), and an icon toggle with an 'Upload icon...' button, alongside a live preview. Section 2, 'SET BUTTON BEHAVIOUR', offers radio buttons to 'Open in a pop-up in the same browser tab' (selected) or 'Open in a new browser tab'. Section 3, 'LINK CONTACT TYPE', allows choosing between 'Meeting type' (selected) or 'Contact form', with a dropdown to select a specific booking page (e.g., 'John Doe's booking page'). Section 4 is the 'Save' button at the bottom right.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Time tracking on' form in Teamleader Focus for logging work hours against projects.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A detailed form for manual time tracking entry. It includes dropdown fields for 'Customer' (set to NV Teamleader), 'Project' (Administration), 'Phase' (Phase 1), 'Task' (Select...), and 'Work type' (Select...). There is a text input for 'Description'. The 'Duration' is set to 01:00:03. 'Started' and 'Ended' fields show date and time pickers (30/05/2022 from 16:08 to 17:08). A 'Billable' toggle is switched on. Action buttons at the bottom include 'Delete time tracking' (red text with trash icon), 'Cancel' (blue text), and a primary 'Save' button (teal).

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The Companies overview list in Teamleader Focus with search and filter options.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A partial view of the Companies module. It features a 'Companies' header, a search bar with the placeholder text 'Search...', and a dropdown filter currently set to 'Show all'. Below these controls is a table with columns for 'Name' and 'Website'. One entry is visible in the list: 'Test company'.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Ask questions' configuration panel for setting up lead capture forms in Teamleader Focus.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This screenshot shows the 'Ask questions' section of a form builder. At the top, there are automation options under 'What do you want us to do with each completed form?': 'Create new contact' (checked) with a dropdown to 'Add tag(s)', 'Create new company' (unchecked), and 'Create new deal' (checked). Below these options is a list of form fields: 'First name', 'Last name', and 'Email', all marked with a red asterisk as required fields. Each field has a drag handle on the left and an edit pencil icon on the right. At the bottom, there is a '+ Add question' button to include more fields in the form.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Browser screen sharing and window management menu in macOS
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A dropdown menu from a browser tab (WebKit getDisplayMedia Prompt) showing screen sharing and window controls. Options include: 'Stop Sharing Window' (highlighted in blue), 'Change Shared Window', 'Share Screen', 'Close Window', 'Minimize', 'Enter Full Screen', 'Tile Window to Left of Screen', 'Tile Window to Right of Screen', and 'Move to Built-in Retina Display'. This is relevant for users troubleshooting screen sharing during Teamleader Focus video calls or meetings.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: A text input field and preview showing a numbered list for 'The meeting host is not present' message.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This image shows a configuration or settings field within Teamleader Focus for customizing automated messages. The field is titled 'The meeting host is not present' with a help icon next to it. It contains a numbered list with placeholder text '1. Item', '2. Item', and a nested list '1. item', '2. item'. Below the input box, there is a 'Preview:' section that renders the numbered list as it would appear to a user, demonstrating how the formatting is applied.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Legal settings section for forms with a checkbox to ask respondents to accept terms and conditions.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A settings panel titled 'Legal' with the subtitle 'Ask users to accept terms and conditions'. It features a teal checkbox that is currently checked, labeled 'Ask respondents to accept terms and conditions.' Below the checkbox, there is a helper text stating 'You can set a custom privacy policy for your team in the team settings.' with a blue hyperlink to 'team settings'. This interface is used within Teamleader Focus to manage GDPR compliance and legal requirements for external forms.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: A sales target widget in Teamleader Focus showing progress for a specific user.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: The image displays a 'Targets' section with a plus icon to add new goals. Below, a specific target card is shown for user Samuel Van Daele with the goal: '5 deals in the phase Aanvaard weekly'. The card includes a pencil icon for editing and a vertical bar chart visualizing progress against the target of 5.0, with color-coded segments (red and pink) indicating current status levels.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Step 3 of a webform setup showing the Webhook URL field and Save button.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot showing the final step of a webform integration process. It includes instructional text: 'After filling in the form, you'll see a Webhook URL. Copy this URL and paste it in the field below'. Below the text is a field labeled 'Webhook URL' containing a specific link starting with 'https://app.teamleader.eu/webhooks/webforms-collect.php?'. At the bottom, there is a blue 'Save' button to finalize the configuration.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Fill in company information' setup wizard showing the Company details section.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A multi-step setup dialog titled 'Fill in company information'. On the left, a navigation menu lists four steps: Company details (active), Company address, Payment information, and Company logo. The main panel shows the 'Company details' form with the following fields: a 'Country' dropdown set to 'Belgium', a 'Company name' text field with the value 'test', an 'Email' field with 'test@mail.com', and a 'VAT' field. A red box highlights the 'Invoicing email' field, indicating it as a point of interest for the user. This screen is part of the initial onboarding or company settings configuration in Teamleader Focus.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: The 'Template for regular mails' form in Teamleader Focus for creating email templates.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A dialog window titled 'Template for regular mails' used to configure email templates. It includes input fields for 'Template name' (required), 'Subject' (required), and a 'Language' dropdown currently set to 'English'. There is an 'Attachments' section with a blue '+' button. The 'Email content' section features a rich text editor with options for Source code, Bold, Italic, Underline, lists, indentation, images, and links. Below the editor is a 'VARIABLES' section listing placeholders that can be used in the template, such as #CLIENT_NAME, #CLIENT_FORENAME, #CLIENT_SURNAME, #CLIENT_ZIPCODE, #CLIENT_CITY, #CLIENT_PHONE, #CLIENT_GSM, #CLIENT_EMAIL, #CLIENT_STREET, #CLIENT_STREET_NUMBER, #CLIENT_COUNTRY, and #SALUTATION.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Form editor for creating a Yes/No question in Teamleader Focus with a live preview.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: This interface shows the configuration for a custom question. On the left, there is a 'Question' text field containing 'Have you been in touch with our company before?', a 'Type' dropdown menu set to 'Yes/No', and an unchecked checkbox for 'An answer is required'. On the right, a 'PREVIEW' box displays how the question will appear to users, showing the question text followed by radio buttons for 'Yes' and 'No'. At the bottom right, there are two buttons: 'Cancel' and a teal 'Save question' button.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Financial overview of a projected subscription invoice that has not been booked yet.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A sidebar or detail view showing the status of a subscription invoice as 'Not booked yet'. It includes three sections: 1. FINANCIALS: Amount excl. VAT (€ 100,00), VAT 21% (€ 21,00), Amount incl. VAT (€ 121,00), and empty fields for Due date and Expected payment date. 2. CUSTOMER: Company name 'Teamleader'. 3. DETAILS: Company entity 'Eline_92_Demo' and Subscription name 'Test'. At the bottom, an information box explains: 'This is a "projected" invoice for a subscription, it hasn\'t been created yet. It will be generated on 23/02/2021.'

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Settings page for customizing text strings for meeting host waiting rooms.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A settings interface titled 'Custom text strings' within Teamleader Focus. It features two editable text areas for customizing messages shown to meeting participants. The first section, 'The meeting host is not present', contains a text box with the message: 'Please wait for the meeting host to let you into the meeting. This page will automatically refresh when the host arrives.' The second section, 'Waiting for the meeting host', contains a text box with: 'Waiting for the meeting host to let you in.' https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Example of a phishing email pretending to be a Teamleader Focus security breach notification.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A screenshot of a malicious phishing email used for security awareness. The email sender is 'notifications@teamsleader.eu' and it contains a link to 'auth.focus.teamsleader.eu'; both instances of the domain name have an extra 's' (teamsleader instead of teamleader) which are highlighted with red underlines to indicate a scam. The message body claims a security breach has occurred and threatens account suspension within 24 hours if the user does not click the link to reset their password. This is a classic example of a phishing attempt targeting Teamleader Focus users.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Diagram explaining GDPR roles: Data subject, Data controller, and Data processor in Teamleader Focus
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description: A workflow diagram illustrating the relationship between three entities regarding personal data. 1. 'Contact of the Teamleader customer' (Data subject) shares personal data with the 'Teamleader customer'. 2. 'Teamleader customer' (Data controller) enters personal data of its contacts into the software of 'Teamleader'. 3. 'Teamleader' (Data processor) securely processes personal data on behalf of the customer. The diagram uses arrows to show the flow of data collection, sharing, and processing to explain GDPR compliance roles within the platform.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Compatibility table for iOS browsers showing support for audio, video, screensharing, and recording.

The table lists browsers (Safari, Chrome, Brave, Firefox, Opera, Edge, Internet Explorer) against features: Audio & video sharing, Basic support, Screensharing, Co browsing, and Recording. For most modern browsers, Audio/Video and Basic support require iOS >= 15.6 (green cells), while Screensharing and Co browsing are 'Viewing only' (orange cells). Recording is unsupported (red cells) across all iOS browsers. Internet Explorer is completely unsupported.

https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.summary: Overview of available Teamleader Focus Boosters: Lead capture, Work orders, and Project management.
https://support.focus.teamleader.eu/hc/a.description:
A list titled 'Your Boosters' showing three add-on modules for Teamleader Focus. Each card includes the booster name, a brief description, the monthly price (billed yearly), and a 'Try for free' button with a dropdown arrow. 

1. Lead capture: €20/month, for web forms and scheduling.
2. Work orders: €20/month, for creating work orders on mobile.
3. Project management: €35/month, for flexible project delivery. 

Each item has a 'What's in it?' expandable link for more details.
